text: Pitkin County is one of the 64 counties in the U.S. state of Colorado. As of the 2020 census, the population was 17,358. The county seat is Aspen. The county is named in honor of the late Colorado Governor Frederick Walker Pitkin. Pitkin County has the seventh-highest per capita income of any county in the United States. ==References== Category:Colorado counties Category:1880s establishments in Colorado Category:1881 establishments in the United States
title: Pitkin County, Colorado
